Package alfdozen.es_2023_2sem_terca_teira_leipl_grupoa

Class ControllerViewSchedule

java.lang.Object
alfdozen.es_2023_2sem_terca_teira_leipl_grupoa.ControllerViewSchedule
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ControllerViewSchedule extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The ViewSchedule class is the controller for the ViewSchedule.fxml file. It manages the GUI components and events in the ViewSchedule scene. The corresponding GUI is used to display the current schedule as a calendar view, save the schedule as a CSV or JSON file, return to the Main menu, create a new schedule or view any schedule conflicts.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
alfdozen

  • Constructor Details

    • ControllerViewSchedule

      public ControllerViewSchedule()

  • Method Details

    • returnHome

      private void returnHome()
      This method is called by the event of clicking on the cancelButton. It returns to the main scene.

    • saveFileCSV

      private void saveFileCSV()
      Event handler for saving the schedule to a CSV file. Shows a file chooser dialog to select the save location. Saves the schedule to the selected file in CSV format. Displays a success message with the file path if the save is successful. Displays an error message if there is an exception while saving.

    • saveFileJSON

      private void saveFileJSON()
      Event handler for saving the schedule to a JSON file. Shows a file chooser dialog to select the save location. Saves the schedule to the selected file in JSON format. Displays a success message with the file path if the save is successful. Displays an error message if there is an exception while saving.

    • createSchedule

      private void createSchedule()
      Loads the "CreateSchedule" scene when the "Create Schedule" button is pressed.

    • conflicts

      private void conflicts()
      Calls showLectureConflicts from App to show a new stage with a list of all the lecture conflicts in the schedule. The conflicts are displayed using the "Overlayed.fxml" file.

    • setLecturesEntries

      private void setLecturesEntries()
      Populates the calendar view with the entries of the lectures in the current schedule. Creates a new calendar source, adds the lecture entries to it and sets it as the calendar source for the calendar view. Also starts a thread to update the current time on the calendar every 10 seconds.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
      Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded. It sets the stage size and title, enables timezone support, and hides the source view. It also adds a listener to the calendar sources, which hides the "Show Calendars" button if it exists. Finally, it calls the setLecturesEntries method to populate the calendar view with lectures.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      arg0 - the URL to the FXML file
      arg1 - the resource bundle associated with the FXML file
